description: Manages educational courses, topics (lessons), content items, and exercises for trainers. Handles AI-generated content, presentations, videos, and DevLab exercises.

field_descriptions.trainer_id: ID of the trainer who created the course
field_descriptions.description: Detailed description of the course content
field_descriptions.skills: Array of skills covered in the course (e.g., ['JavaScript', 'React', 'Node.js'])
field_descriptions.permissions: JSON string containing organization permissions from Directory service
field_descriptions.usage_count: Number of times the course has been accessed/used
field_descriptions.updated_at: Timestamp when course was last modified
field_descriptions.topics: Array of topics (lessons) belonging to the course
field_descriptions.template_id: ID of the template used for this topic
field_descriptions.devlab_exercises: JSONB object containing DevLab exercises with structure: { html: string, questions: array, metadata: object }
field_descriptions.contents: Array of content items for the topic (text, code, presentation, audio, mind_map, avatar_video)
field_descriptions.content_id: Unique identifier for the content item
field_descriptions.content_data: JSONB object containing content-specific data (varies by type)
field_descriptions.generation_method_id: ID of the generation method used (1=video_to_lesson, 2=ai_assisted, 3=manual)

sample_data.description: Comprehensive course covering Python fundamentals and advanced data structures including lists, dictionaries, sets, and algorithms.

topics.description: Learn the basics of Python lists, indexing, and common operations

content_data.text: Python lists are ordered collections of items...

notes: Courses contain multiple topics (lessons), each topic can have multiple content items of different types
devlab_exercises is a JSONB field that can contain HTML, questions array, and metadata
content_data structure varies by content_type_id - text has text/format, code has code/language, presentation has file_url/slides_count
Status field uses soft delete - records are never physically deleted, status changes to 'deleted'
skills is stored as PostgreSQL TEXT[] array
permissions field contains JSON string with organization access control data from Directory service
